member.name: T:PDFiumSharp.ActionTypes
member.summary: PDF Action Types

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.ActionTypes.Unsupported
member.summary: Unsupported action type.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.ActionTypes.GoTo
member.summary: Go to a destination within current document.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.ActionTypes.RemoteGoTo
member.summary: Go to a destination within another document.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.ActionTypes.Uri
member.summary: URI, including web pages and other Internet resources.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.ActionTypes.Launch
member.summary: Launch an application or open a file.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.BitmapFormats.FPDFBitmap_Gray
member.summary: Gray scale bitmap, one byte per pixel.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.BitmapFormats.FPDFBitmap_BGR
member.summary: 3 bytes per pixel, byte order: blue, green, red.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.BitmapFormats.FPDFBitmap_BGRx
member.summary: 4 bytes per pixel, byte order: blue, green, red, unused.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.BitmapFormats.FPDFBitmap_BGRA
member.summary: 4 bytes per pixel, byte order: blue, green, red, alpha.

member.name: T:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions
member.summary: Flags specifying document permissions.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.Print
member.summary: For of 2: Print the document. For of 3 or greater: Print the document (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether is also set).

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.Modify
member.summary: Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by , and .

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.ExtractTextAndGraphics
member.summary: For of 2: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes). For of 3 or greater: Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by .

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.ModfiyAnnotations
member.summary: Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.FillInForms
member.summary: For of 3 or greater: Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if is not set.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.ExtractTextAndGraphics2
member.summary: For of 3 or greater: Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.AssembleDocument
member.summary: For of 3 or greater: Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if is not set.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.DocumentPermissions.PrintHighQuality
member.summary: For of 3 or greater: Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When is not set (and is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.FlattenFlags.NormalDisplay
member.summary: Flatten for normal display.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.FlattenFlags.Print
member.summary: Flatten for print.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.FlattenResults.Fail
member.summary: Flatten operation failed.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.FlattenResults.Success
member.summary: Flatten operation succeed.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.FlattenResults.NothingToDo
member.summary: Nothing to be flattened.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown page mode.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.UseNone
member.summary: Document outline, and thumbnails hidden.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.UseOutlines
member.summary: Document outline visible.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.UseThumbs
member.summary: Thumbnail images visible.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.Fullscreen
member.summary: Full-screen mode, no menu bar, window controls, or other decorations visible.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.UseOC
member.summary: Optional content group panel visible.

member.name: F:PDFiumSharp.PageModes.UseAttachments
member.summary: Attachments panel visible.

member.summary: Get meta-data content from .

The tag to retrieve. The tag can be one of: Title, Author, Subject, Keywords, Creator, Producer, CreationDate, or ModDate.
member.returns: The meta-data.
member.remarks: For detailed explanations of these tags and their respective values, please refer to PDF Reference 1.6, section 10.2.1, 'Document Information Dictionary'.

Handle to a page object. The will be automatically freed.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFImageObj_LoadJpegFile(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_PAGE[],PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_PAGEOBJECT,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load an image from a JPEG image file and then set it into .
member.param: All loaded pages, may be null.
Handle to an image object.
Stream which provides access to an JPEG image.
The number of bytes to read from or 0 to read to the end.
If true, this function loads the JPEG image inline, so the image content is copied to the file. This allows to be closed after this function returns.
member.returns: true on success.
member.remarks: The image object might already have an associated image, which is shared and cached by the loaded pages. In that case, we need to clear the cached image for all the loaded pages. Pass to this API to clear the image cache. If the image is not previously shared, null is a valid value.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFImageObj_SetBitmap(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_PAGE[],PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_PAGEOBJECT,PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP)
member.summary: Set to .
member.param: All loaded pages, may be null.
Handle to an image object.
Handle of the bitmap.
member.returns: true on success.

A value specifying if the font is a CID font or not.
The data, which will be copied by the font object.
The index of the first byte to be copied from .

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_InitLibrary
member.summary: Initialize the PDFium library
member.remarks: Convenience function to call for backwards comatibility purposes.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_InitLibraryWithConfig(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_LIBRARY_CONFIG@)
member.summary: Initialize the PDFium library
member.remarks: You have to call this function before you can call any PDF processing functions.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_DestroyLibrary
member.summary: Release all resources allocated by the PDFium library.
member.remarks: You can call this function to release all memory blocks allocated by the library. After this function is called, you should not call any PDF processing functions.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_LoadDocument(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Open and load a PDF document.
member.param: Path to the PDF file (including extension).
A string used as the password for the PDF file. If no password is needed, or null can be used.
member.returns: A handle to the loaded document, or NULL on failure.
member.remarks: Loaded document can be closed by . If this function fails, you can use to retrieve the reason why it failed.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_LoadMemDocument(System.Byte@,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Open and load a PDF document from memory.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDF document.
Number of bytes in the PDF document.
A string used as the password for the PDF file. If no password is needed, or null can be used.
member.returns: A handle to the loaded document, or NULL on failure.

remarks.para: The memory buffer must remain valid when the document is open. The loaded document can be closed by . If this function fails, you can use to retrieve the reason why it failed.
If PDFium is built with the XFA module, the application should call function after the PDF document loaded to support XFA fields defined in the fpdfformfill.h file.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_LoadCustomDocument(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_FILEREAD,System.String)
member.summary: Load PDF document from a custom access descriptor.
member.param: A structure for accessing the file.
Optional password for decrypting the PDF file.
member.returns: A handle to the loaded document, or NULL on failure.

remarks.para: The application must keep the file resources valid until the PDF document is closed. The loaded document can be closed with FPDF_CloseDocument.
If PDFium is built with the XFA module, the application should call function after the PDF document loaded to support XFA fields defined in the fpdfformfill.h file.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_GetFileVersion(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_DOCUMENT,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the file version of the given PDF document.
member.param: Handle to a document.
The PDF file version. File version: 14 for 1.4, 15 for 1.5, ...
member.returns: True if succeeds, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If the document was created by , then this function will always fail.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_GetLastError
member.summary: Get last error code when a function fails.
member.remarks: If the previous SDK call succeeded, the return value of this function is not defined.

member.summary: Get total number of pages in the document.

member.returns: Total number of pages in the document.

member.returns: A handle to the loaded page, or NULL if page load fails.
member.remarks: The loaded page can be closed using FPDF_ClosePage.

member.summary: Render contents of a page to a device independent bitmap.
member.param: Handle to the device independent bitmap (as the output buffer). The bitmap handle can be created by .
Handle to the page.
Left pixel position of the display area in bitmap coordinates.
Top pixel position of the display area in bitmap coordinates.
Horizontal size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Vertical size (in pixels) for displaying the page.
Page orientation.

for normal display, or combination of the Page Rendering flags defined above. With the flag, it renders all annotations that do not require user-interaction, which are all annotations except widget and popup annotations.

member.summary: Render contents of a page to a device independent bitmap.

The transform matrix.

for normal display, or combination of the Page Rendering flags defined above. With the flag, it renders all annotations that do not require user-interaction, which are all annotations except widget and popup annotations.

member.summary: Close a loaded PDF page.

seealso.cref: !:PdfPage.DeviceToPage((int left, int top, int width, int height), int, int, PageOrientations)
!:PdfPage.PageToDevice((int left, int top, int width, int height), double, double, PageOrientations)

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a device independent bitmap (FXDIB).
member.param: The number of pixels in width for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
The number of pixels in height for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
A value indicating whether the alpha channel is used.
member.returns: The bitmap handle, or if parameter error or out of memory.
member.remarks:
The bitmap always uses 4 bytes per pixel. The first byte is always double word aligned.
The byte order is BGRx (the last byte unused if no alpha channel) or BGRA.
The pixels in a horizontal line are stored side by side, with the left most pixel stored first (with lower memory address). Each line uses width * 4 bytes.
Lines are stored one after another, with the top most line stored first. There is no gap between adjacent lines.
This function allocates enough memory for holding all pixels in the bitmap, but it doesn't initialize the buffer. Applications can use to fill the bitmap using any color.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_CreateEx(System.Int32,System.Int32,PDFiumSharp.BitmapFormats,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a device independent bitmap (FXDIB).
member.param: The number of pixels in width for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
The number of pixels in height for the bitmap. Must be greater than 0.
A pointer to the first byte of the first line if using an external buffer. If this parameter is then the a new buffer will be created.
Number of bytes for each scan line, for external buffer only.
member.returns: The bitmap handle, or if parameter error or out of memory.
member.remarks:
Similar to function, but allows for more formats and an external buffer is supported. The bitmap created by this function can be used in any place that a handle is required.
If an external buffer is used, then the application should destroy the buffer by itself. function will not destroy the buffer.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_FillRect(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_COLOR)
member.summary: Fill a rectangle in a bitmap.
member.param: The handle to the bitmap.
The left position. Starting from 0 at the left-most pixel.
The top position. Starting from 0 at the top-most line.
Width in pixels to be filled.
Height in pixels to be filled.
member.remarks:
This function sets the color and (optionally) alpha value in the specified region of the bitmap.
NOTE: If the alpha channel is used, this function does NOT composite the background with the source color, instead the background will be replaced by the source color and the alpha.
If the alpha channel is not used, the alpha parameter is ignored.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_GetBuffer(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP)
member.summary: Get data buffer of a bitmap.
member.param: Handle to the bitmap as returned by .
member.returns: The pointer to the first byte of the bitmap buffer.
member.remarks:
The stride may be more than width * number of bytes per pixel
Applications can use this function to get the bitmap buffer pointer, then manipulate any color and/or alpha values for any pixels in the bitmap.
The data is in BGRA format. Where the A maybe unused if alpha was not specified.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_GetWidth(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP)
member.summary: Get width of a bitmap.
member.param: Handle to the bitmap as returned by .
member.returns: The width of the bitmap in pixels.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_GetHeight(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP)
member.summary: Get height of a bitmap.
member.param: Handle to the bitmap as returned by .
member.returns: The height of the bitmap in pixels.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_GetStride(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP)
member.summary: Get number of bytes for each line in the bitmap buffer.
member.param: Handle to the bitmap as returned by .
member.returns: The number of bytes for each line in the bitmap buffer.
member.remarks: The stride may be more than width * number of bytes per pixel.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDFBitmap_Destroy(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_BITMAP)
member.summary: Destroy a bitmap and release all related buffers.
member.param: Handle to the bitmap as returned by .
member.remarks: This function will not destroy any external buffers provided when the bitmap was created.

member.name: M:PDFiumSharp.PDFium.FPDF_VIEWERREF_GetName(PDFiumSharp.Types.FPDF_DOCUMENT,System.String,System.Byte@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the contents for a viewer ref, with a given key. The value must be of type "name".
member.param: Handle to the loaded document.
Name of the key in the viewer pref dictionary.
A string to write the contents of the key to.
Length of the buffer.
member.returns: The number of bytes in the contents, including the NULL terminator. Thus if the return value is 0, then that indicates an error, such as when |document| is invalid or |buffer| is NULL. If |length| is less than the returned length, or |buffer| is NULL, |buffer| will not be modified.

member.name: P:PDFiumSharp.PdfPage.Width
member.summary: Gets the page width (excluding non-displayable area) measured in points. One point is 1/72 inch(around 0.3528 mm).

member.name: P:PDFiumSharp.PdfPage.Height
member.summary: Gets the page height (excluding non-displayable area) measured in points. One point is 1/72 inch(around 0.3528 mm).

member.name: P:PDFiumSharp.PdfPage.Size
member.summary: Gets the page width and height (excluding non-displayable area) measured in points. One point is 1/72 inch(around 0.3528 mm).

member.summary: Set if you don't want to catch exceptions.

member.summary: Always use halftone for image stretching.
